Activity: The President went to the Ova1 Office.
The President went to the Diplomatic Reception Room.

The President and the First Lady hosted a coffee in honor of Vice President and Mrs. Walter F. Mondale, on the. occasion of his departure for a visit to Europe and. Japan. For a list of attendees, see AppeNDix "A.". Members of the press
The Presidential party went to the South Grounds of the White House.
The President and Vice President Mondale exchanged remarks.
The President and the First Lady bade farewell to Vice President Mondale.
The President returned to the second floor Residence. He was accompanied by: The First Lady Mrs. James Beverly (Edna) Langford, Judy Carter's. mother
The President had breakfast with: Chip Carter Jeff and Annette. Carter
The President returned to the South Grounds of the White House. He was accompanied by: The First Lady AmyCarter Mrs. Langford
The Presidential party motored from the South Grounds to the First Baptist Church, 16th and. Streets, N.W.
The Presidential party was greeted by the Rev. Charles R. Sanks,Jr,, Associate Pastor of First Baptist Church..

The President and the First Lady attended a Sunday School. couples class. The class was led by Fred M. Gregg,. Executive Vice President for Marketing, Equitable Life Insurance Company, Washington, D.C..
The President and the First Lady met with Charles A. Trentham, Pastor of First Baptist Church.
The President and the First Lady went to the Fellowship Hall.
The President and the First Lady attended a coffee for approximately 100 members Of the congregation.
The Presidential party went to the church sanctuary.
The President and the First Lady attended worship serives. They were accompanied by: Amy Carter Chip and Caron Carter Jeff and Annette Carter Mrs. Langford
The Presidential party returned to their motorcade.
The Presidential party motored from First Baptist Church to the South Grounds of the White House.

The President had lunch with: The First Lady. Amy Carter Jack and Judy Carter. Chip and Caron Carter Jeff and Annette Carter Mrs. Langford.
The President returned to the Ova1 Office.
The President went to the Press Office.
The President returned to the second floor Residence.
The President and the First Lady went to the Blue Room.

The President and the First Lady participated in a swearing- in ceremony for eight members of the Cabinet and four. officials of Cabinet rank.  For alist of attendees, see. APPENDIX"B." Members. of the press.
The President and the First Lady greeted Cabinet members and other officials to be sworn-in..
The Presidential party went to the East Room.
The President introduced Cabinet members and other officials to be sworn-in, Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court. Warren E.  Burger a administered the oaths of office..
The President and the First Lady went to the Grand Hall.
The President and the First Lady received approximately 260guests attending the ceremony.
The Presidential party went to the State Dining Room,
The President and the First Lady hosted a coffee for guests attending the ceremony..
The President returned to the second floor Residence.
The President talked with his Special Assistant for Appointments, Tim I. Kraft.
The President returned to the Ova1 Office,,
